Trump Klaim Tahu Pemimpin Baru ISIS
02 Nov 2019, 02:38 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Presiden AS Donald Trump. (MANDEL NGAN / AFP)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Presiden Amerika Serikat (AS) Donald Trump mengatakan pada Jumat (1/11) pihaknya tahu siapa pemimpin baru kelompok ISIS. Amerika Serikat juga bersumpah untuk terus terus-menerus menekan para pengikut ISIS. "ISIS memiliki pemimpin baru. Kami tahu persis siapa dia!" kata Trump seperti dikutip dari AFP, Sabtu (2/11).ISIS pada Kamis (31/10) mengkonfirmasi bahwa pemimpin mereka Abu Bakar al-Baghdadi telah tewas di tangan AS. Mereka menyebut telah menunjuk Abu Ibrahim al-Hashimi al-Quraishi. Namun, sedikit yang diketahui tentang Hashimi. Namanya jarang disebut-sebut sebagai kemungkinan pengganti Baghdadi setelah ia tewas. Nathan Sales, koordinator anti terorisme Departemen Luar Negeri AS, tidak memberikan rincian tentang Hashimi. Ketika ditanya oleh wartawan, ia hanya mengatakan bahwa Amerika Serikat sedang mencari tahu pemimpin baru ISIS tersebut, perannya, organisasi tempat dia berasal. "Kami akan terus membuat organisasi itu menghadapi tekanan kontraterorisme tanpa henti menggunakan semua alat kekuatan nasional," kata Sales. "Kami akan membongkar kelompok itu terlepas dari siapa kader kepemimpinannya," katanya. (AFP/agt)

Trump Claims to Know ISIS's New Leader
02 Nov 2019, 02:38 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


US President Donald Trump. (MANDEL NGAN / AFP)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - US President Donald Trump said on Friday (1/11) that he knew who the new leader of the ISIS group was. The United States also vowed to continually pressure ISIS followers. "ISIS has a new leader. We know exactly who he is!" Trump said as quoted by AFP on Saturday (2/11). ISIS on Thursday (31/10) confirmed that their leader Abu Bakar al-Baghdadi had been killed at the hands of the US. They said that they had appointed Abu Ibrahim al-Hashimi al-Quraishi. However, little is known about Hashimi. His name is rarely mentioned as a possible successor to Baghdadi after he died. Nathan Sales, the US Department of State's anti-terrorism coordinator, did not provide details about Hashimi. When asked by reporters, he only said that the United States was looking for ISIS's new leader, his role, the organization he came from. "We will continue to make the organization face counterterrorism pressure without stopping using all the tools of national power," Sales said. "We will dismantle the group regardless of who the leadership cadres are," he said. (AFP / Aug)
